meanings.definition: Pseudopodia: temporary protrusions of the cell membrane used for movement and feeding in some unicellular organisms.
meanings.sent1: The amoeba extended its pseudopodia to reach for food.
meanings.sent2: The paramecium uses pseudopodia to capture prey.
meanings.sent3: The pseudopodia of the cell danced around like tiny fingers trying to grab a snack.
meanings.sent4: Her pseudopodia of curiosity stretched out in all directions, exploring the unknown.
meanings.sent5: The pseudopodia wiggled and wriggled, propelling the organism forward in search of nutrients.
